pageContext.claim: “In many cases the scarf is better; it's thicker. I mean you can -- depending on the material, it's thicker.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's observation that scarves may be better than masks is not supported by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. "In settings where facemasks are not available, HCP [healthcare professionals] might use homemade masks (e.g., bandana, scarf) for care of patients with covid-19 as a last resort," the CDC says in its guidance. "However, homemade masks are not considered PPE [personal protective equipment], since their capability to protect HCP is unknown."
